title: Customize your maps
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_split_dt)  q <- ggplot() q <- q + csmaps::annotate_oslo_nor_map_bxxxx_split_dt() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,      y = lat,     group = group,     fill = location_code   ),     color="black",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q

title: Customize your maps
text: also possible specify color user-defined groups. show example assigning different (pseudo) risk level county.
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_split_dt)  # assign each location a random category for different colors location_info <- unique(pd[,c("location_code")]) location_info[,category:=rep(   c("Good","Normal","Neutral","Bad","Very Bad"),   each=3)[1:.N] ] location_info[,category:=factor(   category,   levels=c("Good","Normal","Neutral","Bad","Very Bad")   ) ] print(location_info) #>     location_code category #>            <char>   <fctr> #>  1:  county_nor03     Good #>  2:  county_nor11     Good #>  3:  county_nor15     Good #>  4:  county_nor18   Normal #>  5:  county_nor31   Normal #>  6:  county_nor32   Normal #>  7:  county_nor33  Neutral #>  8:  county_nor34  Neutral #>  9:  county_nor39  Neutral #> 10:  county_nor40      Bad #> 11:  county_nor42      Bad #> 12:  county_nor46      Bad #> 13:  county_nor50 Very Bad #> 14:  county_nor55 Very Bad #> 15:  county_nor56 Very Bad  # join the map data.table pd[   location_info,   on="location_code",   category:=category ]  q <- ggplot() q <- q + csmaps::annotate_oslo_nor_map_bxxxx_split_dt() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,      y = lat,     group = group,     fill = category   ),     color="black",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title="") q <- q + theme_void() q

title: Customize your maps
text: can add labels county index onto maps. several options adding texts graph ggplot2. recommend geom_label() add labels label overlap occurs, otherwise recommend using ggrepel::geom_label_repel().  Labels can easily added layouts, Oslo wards.
code: q <- ggplot() q <- q + csmaps::annotate_oslo_nor_map_bxxxx_split_dt() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,      y = lat,     group = group,     fill = category   ),     color="black",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = csmaps::nor_county_position_geolabels_b2024_split_dt,   mapping = aes(     x = long,      y = lat,     label = location_code   ) ) # ggrepel::geom_label_repel() for avoiding overlap q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = csmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2024_default_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = csmaps::oslo_ward_position_geolabels_b2024_default_dt,   mapping = aes(label = location_code),   color = "red",   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines") ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q

title: Customize your maps
text: convenient use csdata package enrich Norway Oslo maps external information, location name population.

what: Add county name and population to Norway map
title: Customize your maps
code:
# enrich with population and location name dpop_2024 <- csdata::nor_population_by_age_cats()[   calyear==2024 &   granularity_geo %in% "county" ]  # join, create label labels <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_position_geolabels_b2024_split_dt) labels[   dpop_2024,    on = "location_code",   pop_total := pop_jan1_n ] labels[   csdata::nor_locations_names(),    on = "location_code",   location_name_short := location_name_short ] labels[, label := paste0(location_name_short, '
', pop_total)] print(head(labels)) #>    location_code  long      lat  repel pop_total location_name_short #>           <char> <num>    <num> <lgcl>     <num>              <char> #> 1:  county_nor31 11.50 59.00000   TRUE    312152                 ØFO #> 2:  county_nor32 11.20 60.03851   TRUE    728803                 AKR #> 3:  county_nor33  8.85 60.60000   TRUE    269819                 BUS #> 4:  county_nor03  2.20 60.30000  FALSE    717710                 OSL #> 5:  county_nor34 11.10 61.90000  FALSE    376304                 INN #> 6:  county_nor39 10.00 59.32481   TRUE    256432                 VFO #>          label #>         <char> #> 1: ØFO
312152 #> 2: AKR
728803 #> 3: BUS
269819 #> 4: OSL
717710 #> 5: INN
376304 #> 6: VFO
256432  # plot pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_split_dt)  q <- ggplot() q <- q + csmaps::annotate_oslo_nor_map_bxxxx_split_dt() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,     y = lat,     group = group,     fill = location_code   ),   color="black",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + ggrepel::geom_label_repel(   data = labels[repel==TRUE],   mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, label = label),   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines"),   min.segment.length = 0 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = labels[repel==FALSE],   mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, label = label),   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines") ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q

what: Add location name for ward and population for Oslo map
title: Customize your maps
code:
# enrich with population and location name dpop_2024 <- csdata::nor_population_by_age_cats()[calyear==2024]  # join, create label labels <- copy(csmaps::oslo_ward_position_geolabels_b2024_default_dt) labels[   dpop_2024,    on = "location_code",   pop_total := pop_jan1_n ] labels[   csdata::nor_locations_names(),    on = "location_code",   location_name_short := location_name_short ] labels[, label := paste0(location_name_short, '
', pop_total)] print(head(labels)) #>         location_code     long      lat pop_total location_name_short #>                <char>    <num>    <num>     <num>              <char> #> 1: wardoslo_nor030101 10.72000 59.89000     63712            Gml Oslo #> 2: wardoslo_nor030102 10.78000 59.92567     65577               Grünl #> 3: wardoslo_nor030103 10.76683 59.93981     47660                Sagn #> 4: wardoslo_nor030104 10.73555 59.91230     40095            St. Hans #> 5: wardoslo_nor030105 10.66500 59.89925     60646             Frogner #> 6: wardoslo_nor030106 10.65000 59.92500     35425              Ullern #>              label #>             <char> #> 1: Gml Oslo
63712 #> 2:    Grünl
65577 #> 3:     Sagn
47660 #> 4: St. Hans
40095 #> 5:  Frogner
60646 #> 6:   Ullern
35425  q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = csmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2024_default_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = labels,   mapping = aes(label = label),   color = "red",   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines") ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q

title: Layout
text: naming scheme following pattern: scope_geogranularity_type_border_layout_Rclass.

title: Layout
text: content map data contains. Currently focus 2 scopes: Country (Norway). City (Oslo).

title: Layout
text: geographic granularity, defines border county, municipality ward. County (fylke) equivalent NUTS3 (Nomenclature Territorial Unit level 3). Municip (kommune) equivalent LAU2 (Local Administrative Unit level 2). Ward (bydel) administrative region within large municipality. xxx: used plotting position_title (see example).

title: Layout
text: type data object distinguish whether ’s geographical map coordinate label positions. - Map: Map data. - Position geolabels: Geographical coordinates position labels, e.g. “county03” “Oslo”. - Position title (insert oslo): Geographical coordinate position title. far ’s layout: insert_oslo. (see example)

title: Layout
text: Due recent redistricting, exist multiple versions county/municip borders. provide maps match borders following years: 2024: current border, map contains 15 counties. 2020: Border redistricting 2024. map contains 11 counties. 2019: Border redistricting 2020. map contains 18 counties. 2017: Border redistricting 2018. map contains 19 counties. information counties Norway can found .

title: Layout
text: See layout section .

title: Layout
text: R class map object. data.table: applicable maps label/title coordinates. sf: simple feature spatial vector data. sf.

title: Layout
text: 3 layout options Norway map: default, split insert Oslo. Oslo map, default layout.

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_default_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    aes(      x = long,      y = lat,      group = group   ),    color="black",    fill="white",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Default layout") q

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_split_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + csmaps::annotate_oslo_nor_map_bxxxx_split_dt() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    aes(     x = long,      y = lat,      group = group   ),    color="black",    fill="white",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Split layout") q

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_insert_oslo_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,   aes(     x = long,      y = lat,      group = group   ),    color="black",    fill="white",    linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",    x = csmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2024_insert_oslo_dt$long,    y = csmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2024_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo"   ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Insert Oslo layout") q

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(csmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2024_default_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,   aes(     x = long,      y = lat,      group = group   ),    color="black",    fill="white",   linewidth = 0.4 ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Oslo wards") q

title: Interactive maps
text: provide option use sf class object create interactive maps. requres leaflet package.
code: pd_county <- csmaps::nor_county_map_b2024_default_sf leaflet::leaflet(   pd_county,   options = leaflet::leafletOptions(preferCanvas = F) ) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(leaflet::providers$Esri.WorldGrayCanvas) %>%   leaflet::addPolygons(     weight = 0.3,     opacity = 1,     color = "black",      fillColor = "white",     fillOpacity = 0.9   )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Richard Aubrey White. Author, maintainer. Chi Zhang. Author. . Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: White RA, Zhang C (2024). csmaps: Preformatted Maps Norway Need Geolibraries. R package version 2024.9.26, https://github.com/csids/csmaps, https://www.csids./csmaps/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {csmaps: Preformatted Maps of Norway that Don't Need Geolibraries},   author = {Richard Aubrey White and Chi Zhang},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2024.9.26, https://github.com/csids/csmaps},   url = {https://www.csids.no/csmaps/}, }

title: Preformatted Maps of Norway that Don't Need Geolibraries
text: csmaps provides preformatted maps Norway generally need geolibraries. helps public health reporting purposes different geographic levels Norway. following geographic granularities included: County Municipality City ward (Oslo) convenient visualize maps additional information, either using text labels color palettes. Read introduction vignette run help(package="csmaps").

title: Preformatted Maps of Norway that Don't Need Geolibraries
text: csverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing disease surveillance. want install dev versions (access packages haven’t released CRAN), run usethis::edit_r_profile() edit .Rprofile. write : Save file restart R. can now install csverse packages drat repository.
code: options(   repos = structure(c(     CSVERSE = "https://www.csids.no/drat/",     CRAN    = "https://cran.rstudio.com"   )) ) install.packages("csmaps")
